X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Omuh3NTvQS9w0crtfZC3iBh7H41RNCjMuxr4kmah8fNT
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Michael Stack wrote:
> Eric wrote:
>> It would be nice if one could have multiple instances of the same
>> Extractor class in their processing chain. In the case of
>> configuration-heavy extractors one may want two differently configured
>> but same class extractors. Maybe Processor.options should key on the
>> name instead of the class or something...
>  
> Agreed (I made an RFE with your suggestion here: 
> http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1642052&group_id=73833&atid=539102).
> St.Ack

Yes, this should be allowed -- indeed it was the intent of allowing 
processors to have an assigned name separate from their class, and if 
anything in the UI prevents that, it's a bug.

I suspect the motivation here is to apply different configuration 
settings to different target URLs (but still only apply one extractor to 
each URL). This should already be possible in most cases using a single 
Extractor with settings that are changed to new values for some URLs. 
This can be currently be done using 'overrides' (on a domain basis) or 
'refinements' (on a URL regex basis).

The upcoming settings overhaul should eventually make it easier to 
override settings using arbitrary criteria. For example, an upstream 
processor could, as the result of any analysis of the URL pattern or 
content, apply a collection of changed settings to an URL, changing 
later downstream URL processing.

- Gordon @ IA
